events.title: Execution of King Charles I of England
events.description: King Charles I was executed for treason, marking the first time a reigning English monarch was legally tried and executed by his own subjects.
events.significance: This event led to the temporary abolition of the monarchy and the establishment of the Commonwealth of England, profoundly impacting English governance and constitutional history.

events.title: Assassination of Mahatma Gandhi
events.description: Mahatma Gandhi, leader of the Indian independence movement and advocate of non-violence, was assassinated in New Delhi.
events.significance: Gandhi's assassination was a pivotal moment in Indian history, marking the loss of a key leader who shaped the nation's identity and philosophy post-independence.

events.title: Adolf Hitler appointed Chancellor of Germany
events.description: Adolf Hitler was appointed Chancellor, beginning the Nazi regime and leading to profound changes in Germany and the world.
events.significance: This appointment set the stage for World War II and the Holocaust, dramatically altering global history.

events.title: Bloody Sunday in Northern Ireland
events.description: British soldiers shot 26 unarmed civilians during a peaceful civil rights march in Derry, Northern Ireland.
events.significance: The event intensified the conflict known as The Troubles, impacting Northern Ireland's political landscape for decades.
